title: 4 Tips on how to get out of Bronze

embed.description: If your stuck in bronze / silver and don't know how to get out, here's a 4 step plan to get out of Low elo in the next month.

body: If your struggling in low elo it may be because you don't understand the game. Here's 4 things you can do to help that and get yourself out of low elo.

Hey mate, yeah Australian.

The thought train behind no skillshot's is to take that pressure off yourself if your trying to learn how to win. 
They may do the most damage but if you miss 50% of them in a high pressure situation, theres no point.

You do have to consider the difficulty of landing the skillshot though and the cost for missing it. Mundo q cleaver is comparatively easy to land (and pretty cheap and spammable once you get a few tank items) compared to a thresh hook. Some abilities like Sivir Q, Soraka Q or Ashe W can barely be considered skillshots and some champions can just fire off their skillshot as a poke ability with very little concern since it has such a low cooldown and cost if they do miss, like Mundo, Soraka or Lulu's q (outside the lack of a slow for a few seconds and I guess the damage in a high pressure situation but odds are you'll hit with the speed of the ability and the size of the hitbox).

In terms of gameplay Soraka is much easier than Sona for instance despite having more skillshots. You also have to consider things like positioning and the risk of using an ability. I'd say that despite not having many proper skillshots, Riven is quite a difficult champion to play and should be avoided by beginners due to her high skillcap and her allin nature inspiring salty and detrimental mindsets. Whereas in my opinions (as a noob player myself who can't land skillshots), Cho'gath, Veigar or Ammumu are quite beginner friendly.
